Label: Is the solicitor named in the will as an executor?
Is the solicitor the main applicant?
You cannot apply for letters of administration if you are a solicitor applying as an executor.
### How many extra official copies of the grant do you need for use in the UK?

You'll receive an official copy of a grant of probate with your application fee.

Order extra official copies of the grant if you need to send them to different asset holders, for example, a copy for banks, insurance policies, shares and property.

Extra official copies cost £1.50 each.

What is an official copy?

It's a copy of the grant with a holographic silver seal on the front of it. A bank may ask you for a certified copy to release funds to you.

Official copies are used for assets in the UK only.
### How many extra certified copies of the grant do you need for use outside the UK?

Order extra certified copies of the grant if you need to claim the estate outside the UK.

A certified copy will have the same features as the official copy and extra information confirming the details of the certification on the back of it.
Which Inheritance Tax form was filled in?

At the time of their death was the deceased:

## Submit grant of probate applications online You must submit grant of probate applications online, unless an exemption applies. You can submit applications for letters of administration (intestacy) and letters of administration with will annexed (admon will) online when certain conditions apply. Guidance on exemptions, conditions and when application must be submitted by paper ## Inheritance tax Please wait 15 working days before submitting your application to HMCTS. Submitting the IHT400 to HMRC at the same time as your application to HMCTS will cause delays. HMRC take 15 working days to process the IHT400 and issue an Inheritance Tax 421 (IHT421). They will not return the IHT421 to you, it is sent directly to HMCTS.
Enter all executors named in the will. Only 4 lay executors can apply.

This is the legal statement and declaration for you and your client to review. If there are no changes, your client must sign the legal statement using either a digital or wet signature.

You can print the legal statement and declaration and ask your client to sign it for your own records. A photocopy of the signed statement should be submitted along with your evidence in support. 
If you are providing a notarial copy or a court sealed copy of the will please also provide a cover letter with the application indicating where the original will is and why it cannot be released.
You won’t be able to make changes to the legal statement and declaration after continuing.
You will sign a statement of truth on your client’s behalf.

The will is not entitled to proof in England and Wales.

Does the will appoint an executor according to the tenor?

HintText: If a spouse is unable to apply because they lack mental capacity you will not be able to continue this application online.

Label: You can’t use this service if the spouse or civil partner is not renouncing.
Did the adoption take place in England or Wales?
Is there a minority interest in the estate?
You can’t use this service if there is a minority interest.
Does the deceased have any other issue?
The online service can't process cases where the deceased has any other issue, you must apply using the PA1A.
Are any beneficiaries of the estate under the age of 18 years?
You can’t use this service if there is a beneficiary under the age of 18.
Have all of the executors, and residuary legatees or devisees in trust named in the will died or decided not to apply?
You can’t use this service if an executor/residuary legatee/devisee in trust is alive or applying.
Are you named in the will as a residuary legatee or devisee?
You can’t use this service if you are not named in the will as a residuary legatee or devisee.
Does any life interest arise in respect of the estate?
You can’t use this service if there is a life interest in respect of the estate.
